item.title: About
item.description:
Introduction

My name is Mario Pineda Pineda, a student of Computer Engineering. My education and curiosity have led me to explore diverse disciplines such as economics, programming, psychology, music, and gastronomy. Since discovering computer science, I have observed that programming and blockchain technology act as catalysts to unite these interests and create projects that impact and solve real problems. I am a firm advocate for free information and freedom of expression.

item.title: Reflection on Blockchain in Mexico (test)
item.description:
Blockchain technology is no longer just a buzzword in the financial world â€” it has become a real opportunity for transformation in countries like Mexico.

Despite the economic, social, and political challenges we face, the potential of blockchain as a driver of transparency, financial inclusion, and decentralization is immense.

An opportunity to rebuild trust

Mexico is a country with a history marked by corruption and institutional distrust. In this context, blockchain can serve as an immutable and verifiable ledger to reduce the manipulation of public data, government tenders, electoral processes, or social subsidies.
